notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: Leofan men utan don swa us mycel þearf is beon swyðe gemyndige ure agene þearfe

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: Ðeos tid fram ðissum andweardan dæge

notes.head: Note
notes.body: Fol. 4v/21-23 are blank, except for a s. xii pen-trial practising insular letters.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: On ðissum dæge we wurðiað mid lofsangum þone halgan papan þe is gehaten alexander

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: ic axie ærest ðe. et reliqua

notes.head: Note
notes.body: The item is 'followed by a chrismon and a reference in the hand of the text to the continuation to fol. 153/23', line 7 of Item xxx; is 'therefore intended as a much longer alternative beginning' of Item xxx (Ker 1957, p. 398, art. 84).

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 9r) SE GODSPELLERE LVCAS BE| leac þis dæg

notes.head: Note
notes.body: A separate table of contents of Hatton 114.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 15r) MEN ÐA LEOFESTAN | nu for feawum dagum

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 22v) GOD BEBEAD ON ÐÆRE EALDAN Æ

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): VIII KKl Aprilis Adnuntiatio Sanctae Marie

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 30r) M[en þa leofestan] VRE SE ÆLMIHTIGA SCYPPEND

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): Sequentia sancti euangelii secundum lucam

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 36v) Her is gesæd on þissum godspelle

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): Sequentia sancti euangelii secundum marcam

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 49r) Men þa leofestan us is deope beboden þæt we geornlice | mynegian

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 54r) Men þa leofestan uton nu gehyran ure drih|ten wæs sprecende

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): Sequentia sancti euangelii secundum iohannem

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 63v) Se hælend ferde ofer ða galileiscan sæ

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): De Oratione moysi in media quadragessima

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 68r) Æfter þam þe moysees se mæra heretoga

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 85v) L[eofan men] We habbað oft geræd 7 gyt secgað

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 86r) OFT GE (gloss: vos) GEHYRDON EMBE (gloss: circe) ÐÆS | hælendes æriste

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 92r) ÆFTER ÐÆS HÆLENDES ÆRISTE | wæron his discipuli belocene

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 97v) L[eofan men] Ðas dagas synd gehaten. letanie

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 102v) L[eofan men] Uton nu geþencan broðor mine

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 105v) MEN ÐA LEOFESTAN WE MAGON | gehyran secgan be ure sawle þearfe

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 111r) MEN ÐA LEO|festan þys syndon halige dagas

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 115r) LEOFAN MEN | us is mycel þearf. þæt we wære (gloss: cauem[us]) beon

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 131v) M[en þa leofestan] FRAM ÐAM HALGAN EASTERLI|can dæge

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 140r) GREGORIUS SE HALGA PAPA | engliscre ðeode apostol

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 147r) M[en þa leofestan] PHILIPPUS. SE GODES. APOSTOL þe we on þisum dæge wurþiað

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 147r) WE WURÐÍÁÐ EAC ON DISSERE FREOLS|tide

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 151r) MEN ÐA LEOFESTAN NU TODÆG WE | wuþiað

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 153r) ON ÐISUM DÆGE ÐROWODE SUM | arwurðe papa. a;exander gehaten

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): VIII Kl iulii Natiuitas Sancti Iohannis Baptistae

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 156v) SE GODSPELLERE LUCAS AWRAT ON CR[IST]ES | bec

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): III Kl iulii Sanctorum Apostolorum Petri et Pauli

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): De Passione Beatorum Apostolorum Petri et Pauli

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 166r) WE WILLAÐ ÆFTER ÐISUM GODSPELLE | eow gereccan

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 190r) WYRDWRITERAS SECGAÐ ÐÆT ÐRY | leodscypas syn gehatene

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 200r) Be þam | þe ðam sacerde naht fremað þ[æt] he rihtwis beo gyf he þam | unrihtwisan styran nele heora unrihtes

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 200v) Be massepreostes drohtnunge | Ælc mæssepreost sceal beon swa he geha|ten sacerd

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 201r) MEN ÐA LEOFESTAN. WEOR|þian (gloss: uen[er]emur) we nu on andweardnysse

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 212r) MANEGUM (gloss: multis) IS CUÐ SEO HALIGE STOW S[AN]C[T]AE | michaheles

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 221r) HALIGE LAREOWAS RÆDDON. | þæt seo geleaffulle (gloss: fidelis) gelaðung

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 230r) Matheus se godspellere. us sæde on ðysum god|spelle. þ[æt] ure hælend crist

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 242v) Leofan menn. Ðeos symelnyss þissere cyr|can halgunge

objectDesc.support: Parchment. Fols i, 250 and 251 are modern paper flyleaves. Fols 248-49 are added by
objectDesc.extent:
267 mm x 160 mm (dimensions of all - size of leaves).
200 mm x 94 mm (dimensions of all - size of written space).
objectDesc.layoutDescription: Leaves are arranged HFFH. Ruled for 23 long lines. Double bounding lines, right and left. Prickings are usually visible in the side margins and at the top and bottom.

handDesc.summary: The main text in fols 9-201 is by one scribe. Fols 201r/9-30r/17 look to be in another hand which also wrote the additions on fols 236r/1-42v/6 and 1r/1-4v/9. Fols 230r/18-35v/23 and 242v/7-46v/1 are in a different hand. A hand which may belong to

characters.note: The shape of the second element of æ is influenced by the letter which succeeds it.
e is round-backed or horned depending on its place in the word and the following letter.
The descender of þ is notched.
Most ascenders except that of þ are clubbed, but some ascenders have wedged clubs and some are wedged; for example, on h and b, in English and Latin.
Caroline a, sometimes with high bow.
g is wide and open with long descender.
or ligature, is not very straight on the line.
The feet of h are vestigial.
The ascender of þ is wedged.
All ascenders except that of þ are clubbed.
The angle of the tironian nota is almost 90˚.

hands.name: Coleman
hands.summary: Unsigned, rustic capitals. A signature '[c]plfman' appears in

hands.name: glosses and alterations
hands.description: There are several layers of glosses by the

binding: Rebound in the nineteenth century. Binding leather and very fragile.
accompanying: Joscelyn wrote a gloss on fol. 18v and marginalia on fols 36v, 42v and 49r, but he did not draw on Hatton 114 for his Anglo-Saxon word lists. Dugdale wrote a table of contents on fol. 248 in 1644. 'Saxon | Homilies tom: 1' is written in the upper margin of fol. 1r in the same hand as one which adds titles to other Hatton manuscripts. In the lower margin a different hand has writeen 'MS. Junius | 22'. This is now crossed out, and 'Hatton 114' is written in pencil alongside it in a modern hand.

history.provenance: Likely to have been in Worcester in the early thirteenth century, when the Tremulous Hand annotated it, and still in Worcester in 1638, as it was referred to as a Worcester manuscript in a letter from Ussher to Spelman dated 6th November 1638 (Oxford, Bodleian, Additional C. 301, fol. 48) (Ker 1957, p. 399).
history.acquisition: Belonged to Christopher, Lord Hatton in 1644. Given to the Bodleian Library in 1675. It was then lent to Dr Thomas Marshall and by him to Junius and returned to the Bodleian as part of the Junius collection after his death in 1678. Formerly Junius 22.

admin: Manuscript described by Mary Swan and Helen Foxhall Forbes with the assistance of Hollie Morgan and Owen Roberson. (2010; 2013).
